revised_title: Molecular Structure and Oestrogenic Activity: Compounds without a Phenanthrene Nucleus
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the molecular structure of compounds without a phenanthrene nucleus and their oestrogenic activity. They discovered that 4:4'-dihydroxy-diphenyl methane is the most potent member of the series and that the presence of a phenyl nucleus reduces its efficacy. The study also found that the introduction of methyl groups in the 3:3' positions can diminish the potency of some substances.
